With our world-class institutions, Illinois would make a perfect home for a National Semiconductor Technology Center.
 
Our state will lead us into the future of manufacturing. It's one of the reasons I’m proud to have supported the CHIPS and Science Act.
axios.com/2023/10/04/nstc-se…

Every day, brave Ukrainians are fighting for their freedom and sovereignty. They need our uninterrupted support to defeat Putin.

We cannot wait. House and Senate leadership must immediately advance legislation that would provide additional aid for Ukraine.duckworth.senate.gov/news/pr…

On Latina Equal Pay Day and every day, let's be perfectly clear:

All women deserve equal pay for equal work. Now.

Let's finally pass the Paycheck Fairness Act.

When predatory corporations come after our servicemembers, the CFPB helps protect their hard-earned dollars so they can focus on what really matters: protecting our nation.

When we #DefendCFPB, we defend our nation's heroes.

The Supreme Court must do the same.

Wide bipartisan majorities in both chambers of Congress agree: Ukraine has to win this war and Russia has to lose it.

Continued aid should not be a political issue. Let’s get it done.

We’ve already seen what the brave Ukrainians fighting for their freedom can do with our help—they’ve repelled Russia’s brazen aggression and shown that they can win this war.
 
We can’t afford to let up now.

Congratulations @LaphonzaB! It’s all hands on deck here in the Senate to keep supporting working families and protecting reproductive rights, and I’m glad to have your fierce voice and work ethic to help us deliver.

Welcome to the @SenateDems team.

House Republicans have a choice to make. Is blocking continued aid to Ukraine worth sacrificing American troops if Putin continues to march further West?

@VoteVets and I think the answer is easy. We must support Ukraine. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1djxXNgkDqvGZ

It’s simple. A world with a Ukrainian victory is a safer one—and House Republicans need to recognize that.

Put our partner and national security first and stop blocking continued aid to Ukraine.

During Domestic Violence Awareness Month, we reaffirm our commitment to protecting and supporting all survivors of abuse.

We hear you, and we believe you.

If you or someone you know needs help, please call the National Domestic Violence Hotline at 1-800-799-7233.

Today, the Supreme Court will begin hearing oral arguments that will determine the fate of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

Republicans are trying to kill this agency for one simple reason:

It stands up for consumers and working families.

We must #DefendCFPB.

50 years ago, the Rehabilitation Act became law—chipping away at the barrier of exclusion shutting people with disabilities out and helping lay the foundation for the ADA.
 
Proud to be at the White House to celebrate our progress and recommit to our work for full accessibility.

Make no mistake: standing up to Russian aggression and upholding the rule of law are important for our national security, and I will do everything in my power to ensure uninterrupted aid to Ukraine so they can defeat Putin’s authoritarian regime and win this war.

While I’m disappointed that House Republicans retreated from efforts to lend aid to our partner in Ukraine in tonight’s funding deal, I’m glad Leader Schumer and Senator McConnell agreed the Senate will keep working to advance additional Ukraine aid before the end of the year.

BREAKING: The Senate passed a bipartisan funding deal free of extreme MAGA poison pills that keeps the government open and spares millions of working families the pain of a needless shutdown, while also preserving funding for border security and doubling critical disaster relief.
I’ve spoken with @ILStatePolice Director Brendan Kelly and have been briefed on this tragic situation. I hope all Illinoisans in the vicinity stay safe.

My heart goes out to the families and loved ones of those impacted by the crash and chemical leak in Teutopolis, and I’m monitoring the situation closely. 

I urge everyone in the area to follow the guidance of local authorities as we continue to learn more about this situation.
Rare I agree with McConnell, but Kevin McCarthy should take notes from a Republican leader who is actually acting like an adult.

With our ongoing aviation safety crisis, there couldn't be a worse time for House Republicans to manufacture a shutdown that would force air traffic controllers to work without pay and suspend training.

The House GOP is putting the flying public at risk.

Reminder: the Senate has legislation that is widely supported on both sides of the aisle to avoid a shutdown.

There is a bipartisan way out of this mess if House Republicans would just… do their jobs.
To the @UAW workers picketing at Ford's Chicago plant, I am with you and will always support the right of workers to collectively bargain for better wages and working conditions.

Dianne Feinstein was a trailblazing woman who devoted her life to public service.

My heart goes out to her loved ones, the people of California and everyone whose life was improved by her work.

Rest in peace, @SenFeinstein.

"No one is more military than me" says a man who has never served a day in his life in a room with several actual Veterans. Is he serious?
 
Well said, @SenMarkKelly.

NEWS: Today I reintroduced my Websites and Software Applications Accessibility Act alongside @RepSarbanes and @PeteSessions to finally help make websites and other technology more accessible for all users, including those in the disability community. It’s overdue.

🚨VETS: September 30th is the last day for post-9/11 Veterans to apply for free VA care and benefits to help treat the damage caused by exposure to toxins during their military service.

Remember, symptoms can show up years later—so don't wait!
 
Apply at VA.gov/PACT.

Republicans are pushing our government straight toward a shutdown that will:

Devastate our economy, halt SNAP, Social Security and other critical services and hurt working families.

You'd think that'd be enough to make them put partisanship aside and do their jobs to stop this.

Look Tuberville, anyone who is willing and able to serve deserves the chance to do the job. 

That's what America stands for.

The only thing here that isn't based on merit is your months-long hold that is preventing hundreds of well-merited promotions.

Good news! @United is making it easier to fly for passengers who rely on wheelchairs to get around.

Now, we need every airline to do the same.

We need to pass my MOBILE Act.

Yes, it's good we confirmed three top military officers last week—but that also immediately created three new vacancies that we now have to fill.

It's three steps forward and three steps back.

Senator Tuberville must stop endangering national security and end his hold.

The charges against Senator Menendez are very serious and deeply troubling allegations of abuse of the public trust and corruption.
 
For the same reasons he needed to step down as Chair of the Foreign Relations Committee, he should resign as Senator.

chicago.suntimes.com/columni…

I hate this... but a deal is a deal.

We'll get ya next time, @SenatorBaldwin!
Wishing all those observing Yom Kippur a meaningful, peaceful and easy fast. G'mar Chatimah Tovah.

Proud to join Illinoisans on the picket lines today as they fight for working families across the nation and demand a fair, living wage for autoworkers.

In solidarity, @UAW!

Great to be back at @CityClubChicago today to talk about all the ways I’m working to bring investments and jobs to our state.

Illinois is ready to help bring our world into the future—and I’m going to do everything in my power to make sure the whole world knows it.

The #1 killer of kids in America isn't cancer or car accidents—it's gun violence.

Now, for the first time ever, the White House will finally have its own office solely dedicated to addressing this crisis and saving lives.

Thank you, @POTUS and @VP.

On every Congressional Delegation I lead overseas, I tell our partner countries: if you’re looking to come to or expand business in the U.S., Illinois is the place to do it.

Tune in as I share some of my successful efforts abroad at @CityClubChicago: piped.video/Kc6esre8Pcw

American homeowners and consumers rely on the rights and protections put in place by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
 
The Supreme Court must side with working families and uphold CFPB's ability to do its job.

I'm with you, @SenFettermanPA. Accessibility should be the default—not an afterthought.

Because of Tuberville's months-long hold, military families are unsure where their kids are going to school...

Military spouses quit their jobs unsure if they're moving to a new duty station...

He's messing with military families lives' for his own political agenda. It's sick.

After securing significant funding for our nation's diaper banks over the last few years, I'm proud Illinoisan families have greater access to the diapers they need.

This National Diaper Need Awareness Week, please help me share these resources about local diaper banks:

These last few years, @SenKevinCramer and I worked hard to secure major federal funding to support our nation’s diaper banks.

Now, this National Diaper Need Awareness Week, we reintroduced our bipartisan bill to help build on our progress and end diaper need for all families.
A world with a Ukrainian victory is a safer one, and I hope House Republicans will stop holding up the aid needed to help make that happen.
So long as Ukraine needs our support, the U.S. should not shy away from our role as a global leader in the fight to uphold democracy and the rule of law.
After hearing from President @ZelenskyyUa this morning, one thing remains clear: Ukraine has to win this war and Russia has to lose it.

Happy Birthday @AmeriCorps! Thank you for being a leading example of "American Service", giving countless Americans opportunities to volunteer and better their communities for the last 30 years. Here's to the next 30 years.
My statement on U.S. Steel’s announcement to temporarily idle blast furnace ‘B’ at the Granite City Works Plant—hurting countless working families.

Women in Wisconsin shouldn’t have had to live like this—but because Trump was able to “kill Roe v. Wade," legal abortions were banned for more than a year. In a blue state.

We must enshrine full reproductive rights into law so this never happens again. forbes.com/sites/alisondurke…

"Don't Ask, Don't Tell" was wrong.

It forced many brave enough to serve to conceal their most authentic selves—and our military suffered as a result.

We are so much stronger having rid our nation of this hateful, discriminatory policy 12 years ago today.

Great news for Illinois! I’m proud @the182AW was selected, allowing the 182nd to continue its mission, protecting hundreds of good-paying local jobs and maintaining the ability for the Air National Guard to respond to new emergencies and domestic missions in the process.

NEWS: As we keep working to implement the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and other landmark legislation, I’m calling on the Biden Administration to make it easier for state and local recipients of federal funds to expand diverse job growth, support workers and grow their economy.

Senator Tuberville is putting our national security on the line—and you know what he’s doing? Fundraising.

Shame on him.

And our democracy is stronger when every voice is heard.

On this National Voter Registration Day, please make sure to visit vote.gov to check and update your registration.

Congrats to @uofigrainger on this partnership to incubate the talent that will help make innovation happen now and well into the future.

When it comes to building the workforce of tomorrow, Illinois is leading the way.

Because of the resilience of the 81 Thai garment workers, the so-called “land of the free” learned of the modern-day slavery still taking place on its own soil.

Because of them, our Union is more united than ever in its efforts to keep safe every worker who calls it home.

I can't believe it's been three years without our fearless, irreplaceable Supreme Court Justice RBG.

We must protect her legacy.

In the 1980s, 81 workers were tricked into leaving Thailand, denied their rights and forced to work for years in a sweatshop in California. 

Today, I'm proud to join @ActSecJulieSu to honor their story and help ensure this tragedy never happens again. dol.gov/general/live
Happy 76th Birthday to the @USAirForce! Cheers to the nearly 700,000 American Airmen that deliver airpower anytime, anywhere—Fly, Fight, and Win!

Years. To. Recover.
politico.com/news/2023/09/14…
Wishing a very happy and healthy new year to all those celebrating Rosh Hashanah! Shana Tova!

I wouldn’t be a mother today without the miracle of IVF.

I'm proud to help reintroduce legislation alongside @PattyMurray to expand access to fertility treatments like IVF for Veterans and help them fulfill their dreams of having a family.

Every National POW/MIA Recognition Day, I’m thinking of the brave servicemembers who redefine the word “courage”—even in the most harrowing of circumstances. 

While we can never repay them, may we all strive to live every day in a way that honors their tremendous sacrifices.

Happy Hispanic Heritage Month!
 
Where would America be without the many trailblazers, leaders and brilliant minds in the Latino community—past, present and future. Diversity makes us stronger, this month and always.

Our bill would help treat it as such.

NEWS: Today, I’m proud to team up with @SenMarcoRubio and @RepHoulahan and announce the introduction of our bicameral, bipartisan Access to Donor Milk Act of 2023 to support donor milk banks nationwide and help ensure families have what they need to raise strong, healthy babies.

Democrats defeated the gun lobby in 1994 to enact a nationwide ban on assault weapons.

But in 2004, Republicans let it expire—turning their backs on American families.

And mass shootings tripled.

It's time they put human lives ahead of checks again.

Reinstate the ban.

As a fellow pilot, I’m crestfallen to learn of @Rep_Peltola's husband’s fatal plane crash yesterday. My heart goes out to her, her family and the people of Alaska during this difficult time.

May his memory be a blessing.

When Democrats expanded the Child Tax Credit, we cut child poverty nearly in half.

NEARLY IN HALF.

But Republicans let that expansion expire—

And the reported rise in child poverty is a direct consequence of that policy choice.

Shame on them.
A lawmaker who doesn’t know the law is a recipe for disaster.

It's National Disability Voting Rights Week.

When Americans with disabilities vote, not only is our democracy stronger—but we move our nation closer to that more just, more equitable America we all deserve.

I'll always speak out against any attempt to weaken our rights.

My thoughts are with the families impacted by the explosion at the Archer Daniels Midland facility in Decatur last night.

I am monitoring this situation closely and wish all those who were injured a swift recovery.

Today, we remember the nearly 3,000 Americans who lost their lives on September 11, 2001—as well as the brave first responders who ran toward danger to save thousands while others ran away.
 
Their sacrifices can never be repaid nor forgotten.

After experiencing mild symptoms, I tested positive for COVID-19 today. 

I will continue working for the people of Illinois in isolation and follow medical guidance on when to return to the Senate chamber.

This World Suicide Prevention Day, let’s all take a moment to check in on our loved ones.

And if you're struggling, there's always someone to talk to at the National Suicide Prevention hotline, just dial 988.

Remember, you are not alone.

Here’s a few poems I learned during my service in the Army:

May the best team win.

Look, the fact that seat belts are required in planes and cars—but not on our kids' school buses—is troubling.

Today, I’m announcing the reintroduction of my School Bus Safety Act so we can do more to keep our kids safe as they travel to and from school. In Illinois and beyond.

Roses are red, violets are blue.

Poems aren't hurting our military.

No Coach, that's you.
I couldn’t agree more.
I can’t believe this was published in 2023 😳

Did you see Roll Call's ableist cartoon yesterday? 

The daily experience of Americans with disabilities has no business being the punchline in any joke.

Senator Tuberville, several times: "My hold isn't hurting military readiness."

Three service secretaries: "You're wrong.”

What more does Senator Tuberville need to hear?

Congratulations to my dear friend @johnatkinsonil on his new role as chair of @intersectillin1! I can think of no one better to help continue the work of expanding economic development in our state.

Trickle down economics never worked—but every jobs report, we're proving Bidenomics does.

#DemocratsDeliverMoreJobs.

To some naysayers, the Food Stamp Act of 1964 was the start of a mere "government hand-out." But they're wrong.

To millions of families—including my own—it can be a lifeline to help put food on the table.

It's the power of government at its best.

And I will always defend it.

Republicans—how can you read these text messages from students and not weep?

Not feel compelled to do something to stop this?

When will students' lives matter more to you than your checks from the gun lobby?

As DOL Acting Secretary, @ActSecJulieSu has helped:

—Broker a new contract for port workers
—Unveiled rules on how companies benefiting from the Inflation Reduction Act need to protect workers

Give her a follow! Then, let's confirm her so she can keep doing the job.

To me, there has never been a worse time to weaken pilot regulations.

Anyone who votes to reduce the 1,500 hour rule for pilot training will have blood on their hands when the inevitable accident occurs thanks to an inadequately trained flight crew. time.com/6309503/congress-ai…

With the Inflation Reduction Act, Democrats took on Big Pharma and won.

We empowered Medicare to negotiate the price of prescription drugs to help ensure no senior ever goes without the life-saving medication they need.

Let the negotiations begin.

On my Congressional Delegation to the Indo-Pacific, my goal was simple: strengthen our partnerships across Southeast Asia to strengthen our overseas partners’ economic investments that help power our economy here at home. In Illinois and beyond.

Too many in the disability community know what it's like to be denied or charged exorbitant extra fees to fly with a service animal.

It's so much more than a simple inconvenience. It's unjust and unnecessary.

I'm committed to fixing this.
washingtonpost.com/wellness/…

On August 28, 1955, Emmett Till was abducted, bludgeoned and brutally murdered by white supremacists. He was only 14.

His horrific story should never be forgotten.

And with the site of his wake finally designated as a national monument, we're helping make sure it isn’t.

Today marks the 60th anniversary of the historic March on Washington where hundreds of thousands of brave patriots took to the streets and demanded equal rights for all Americans.

Until Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s dream is fully realized, our work will not be finished.

On Women's Equality Day, we celebrate the brilliant, resilient women who came before us determined to build a better, more inclusive America for all of us.

Let's be clear: we won't go back. 

I refuse to let my daughters grow up with fewer rights than I had.

Happy Reproductive Freedom Day! Here in Illinois, we will always welcome those seeking their fundamental right to reproductive care with open arms.

But I won't stop working to ensure this right is enshrined for everyone in every state.
"More assault weapons" is not the answer. The answer is a nationwide ban on weapons of war that have no business being on our streets in the first place.

The Inflation Reduction Act is saving working families tens of thousands of dollars on healthcare costs.

In fact, many Illinoisans will save roughly $433 per year on Rx costs when new Medicare policies begin in 2025.

It's indisputable. Democrats are the party of healthcare.

The longer this personal, political blockade drags on, the longer our military families are left wondering where they'll find housing or where their kids will go to school.

If Senator Tuberville really cared about military families, he'd end his hold.

86,000 new jobs created.
270+ new clean energy projects announced.
$132 billion invested in our climate crisis.

Huge news! President Biden's SAVE Plan will undoubtedly be a lifeline for millions of hardworking Americans—saving them money as they restart their monthly student loan repayments in September.

As dangerously hot temperatures move through our state this week, here's a few quick reminders:
 
—Limit time outdoors
—Hydrate as much as possible
—Free cooling centers are available across Illinois; find one near you at keepcool.aem-int.illinois.go…
 
Stay safe, Illinoisans!

We cannot forget. Black history is American history—and I'm working to preserve it.

It's time we designate the site of this horrific tragedy a national monument.

When President Biden signed the Inflation Reduction Act into law, Congressional Democrats succeeded in finally capping the monthly cost of insulin at $35 for seniors on Medicare.

And Democrats will keep working until we cap costs for every American.

Reminder: every single Republican in Congress voted against the Inflation Reduction Act; while Democrats are delivering lower Rx costs, curbing inflation, powering our economy and tackling the climate crisis.

One year after @POTUS and Congressional Democrats enacted the Inflation Reduction Act, all have benefited from:

—Lower Rx costs
—$35/month cap on Medicare insulin costs 
—Boosts in manufacturing and clean energy
—A fairer tax code
—Investments in climate action

—Capping Medicare insulin costs
